attributes.action: NOT to extradite Garry Mckinnon to the United States
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Garry Mckinnon is facing extradition to the United States for hacking into the US computer system while searching for evidence of UFOs. Mr Mckinnon suffers from Asperger's syndrome and yet his appeal was turned down 3rd April 2009.
 
We believe that Garry Mckinnon should not be extradited to the US but dealt with within the legal system of the UK.  He is being dealt with under legislation designed for the extradition of terrorists after the atrocities of 9/11. Mr Mckinnons treatment is an abuse of that legislation.

rejection.details: Home Secretary Alan Johnson has said he cannot intervene in this case. We also cannot accept petitions concerning individual legal cases. Please refer to our terms and conditions: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
